cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 45 mi ENE of Kingston, Jamaica
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW today, turning NW tonight–Monday, crossing central/western Cuba Monday, entering the Florida Straits, then moving northward just offshore the west coast of Florida toward the Big Bend Tuesday–Wednesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along Florida’s west coast – likely near the Big Bend region north of Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warnings for southern Haiti, Jamaica, and many eastern-central Cuban provinces
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Keys northward through the Big Bend is expected to experience impacts
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Tuesday afternoon through early Wednesday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in Tampa Bay and adjacent coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with localized totals up to 6 inches Monday night–Wednesday; isolated flash flooding risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rainbands; rough seas and dangerous marine conditions in Tampa Bay approaches.
